metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8393 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
pcregrep in PCRE before 8.38 mishandles the -q option for binary files,which might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via acrafted file, as demonstrated by a CGI script that sends stdout data to aclient.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
